channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot hole opposite farm entrance, 13th November
item.description:
Outside number 83 and getting larger every day has been filled on several occasions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip causing debris build up and grass growing into road, 13th November
item.description:
The dropped kerb is too low and the tarmac is missing in parts so that a large amount of debris builds up from the local trees etc and settles there. I cleaned it out a year ago but its come back already. You can see from the photos how the grass is growing into the road causing yet more of a hinderance to the flow of water and debris away, even though rained heavily yesterday 12 Nov

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Painswick Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Lack of shelters, 13th November
item.description:
No bus shelters at numerous stops along the whole B 4063 Cheltenham Road and Cheltenham Road East, many bus stops repositioned ,yet no shelter In bad weather for Stage Coach customers ,seems very short sighted ,that orders for shelters were not placed before Cycle Spine work started ???.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road curves down, road is broken and water is gathering., 13th November
item.description:
Outside 4 St Paul's Street North, Cheltenham, GL50 4AQ. This has been happening for sometime, mostly when it rains. All the terrace houses water drains onto the road and gathers outside this property on the road. You can see the dip in the road by the kerb. This part of road does not dry. Caused damage to the front of house wall, damp rising up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Saint Pauls Street North, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Footways work, 13th November
item.description:
At 12 Blenheim Square, Cheltenham, there has been a lot of construction going on over the past couple of months.My main concern is the fact they have now started to drop the curb which is creating problems for many reasons. Firstly, this is a residential area, with many older people and young children around, I am very concerned for safety since they have dug a reasonably sized ditch to do this, with no signage about "closed footways" or anything to that affect, there is only a plastic fence (put up on the the Saturday the 8th of November). These plastic fences are also blocking a portion of the public road, meaning cars have a hard time getting past this part of the road. I am wondering whether or not they are even authorised to do this kind of work since it doesn't seem to be anywhere in public access. Assuming this issue will be moved forward with, I would like to stay anonymous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Blenheim Square, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 13th November
item.description:
Customer reports that the traffic light head has rotated 90 degrees and is now facing Southbound A40 traffic. This means that the A40 traffic get a green light when the Shipton Oliffe traffic is also cleared to enter the junction.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Further sinkholes developing around this junction, now including on Leckhampton Road as well as the junction with top of Old Bath Road. Erosion of sub structure beneath tarmac. Several ruts and holes developing across the junction area and road., 13th November
item.description:
Junction of Old Bath Road with Leckhampton Hill Road travelling South up the hill. Junction area and also on the Leckhampton Hill Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
